Description: Fragment of a faience artefact, very eroded and in bad condition, few traces of glaze preserved, may be part of a base of some sort (shabti) that gets thinner to the top (legs?). At the left side of the leg three black parallel lines that are askew, sloping down towards the right side. Three parts of original sides are preserved, all the rest is broken off.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 120)
